projects.title: Task Manager REST API
projects.description: Build a RESTful API for task management with user authentication, CRUD operations, and PostgreSQL/MongoDB database
projects.shortDescription: REST API with authentication and database integration
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-quality task manager API using Node.js/Express or Django/Flask. Implement user authentication with JWT, CRUD operations for tasks, proper error handling, and database integration. This project teaches API design, authentication, database relationships, and backend best practices - all fundamental skills for backend development.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Project & Database
implementationSteps.description: Initialize Node.js/Express or Django/Flask project. Set up PostgreSQL or MongoDB database. Create User and Task models with relationships (one user has many tasks). Define schema: User (id, email, password) and Task (id, title, description, status, userId, createdAt). Use Sequelize/Mongoose or Django ORM for database operations.

implementationSteps.title: Implement User Authentication
implementationSteps.description: Create /signup and /login endpoints. Hash passwords using bcrypt before storing. Generate JWT tokens on successful login with user ID in payload. Create authentication middleware to verify JWT tokens on protected routes. Handle errors: duplicate email, invalid credentials, expired tokens.

implementationSteps.title: Build Task CRUD Endpoints
implementationSteps.description: Create protected routes: GET /tasks (list all user tasks), POST /tasks (create task), GET /tasks/:id (get single task), PUT /tasks/:id (update task), DELETE /tasks/:id (delete task). Ensure users can only access their own tasks. Implement validation: required fields, task status enum (pending/in-progress/completed).

implementationSteps.title: Add Filtering & Search
implementationSteps.description: Enhance GET /tasks with query parameters: ?status=completed, ?search=keyword. Implement pagination: ?page=1&limit=10. Add sorting: ?sortBy=createdAt&order=desc. Use database queries efficiently (avoid N+1 problems). Return proper JSON responses with metadata (total count, current page).

implementationSteps.title: Error Handling, Testing & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Implement centralized error handling middleware. Use proper HTTP status codes (200, 201, 400, 401, 404, 500). Add input validation with express-validator or Pydantic. Write basic tests with Jest/Mocha or pytest. Document API with Postman collection. Deploy to Heroku/Railway/Render with environment variables for secrets. Add live API link to portfolio.

projects.title: Blog API with Content Management
projects.description: Build a complete blog API with user roles, post management, comments, categories, and image uploads
projects.shortDescription: Full-featured blog API with authentication and relationships
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-ready blog backend API with advanced features: user roles (admin/author/reader), post CRUD with rich text, comment system, category/tag management, image upload to cloud storage, and search functionality. This project demonstrates complex database relationships, file handling, authorization, and real-world backend architecture.

implementationSteps.title: Database Schema & Models
implementationSteps.description: Design schema: User (id, email, password, role), Post (id, title, content, authorId, categoryId, imageUrl, published, createdAt), Comment (id, postId, userId, content), Category (id, name). Create relationships: User has many Posts, Post has many Comments, Post belongs to Category. Use foreign keys and proper indexing for performance.

implementationSteps.title: Authentication & Authorization
implementationSteps.description: Implement JWT-based auth with user roles (admin, author, reader). Create middleware to check user roles: isAuthenticated, isAdmin, isAuthor. Authorization logic: only admins can delete any post, authors can edit their own posts, readers can only view published posts. Handle permission errors with 403 Forbidden responses.

implementationSteps.title: Post Management & Image Upload
implementationSteps.description: Build post endpoints: GET /posts (public, only published), POST /posts (authors only), PUT /posts/:id (author/admin), DELETE /posts/:id (admin). Implement image upload using multer (Node.js) or Django file handling. Store images on Cloudinary or AWS S3. Save image URL in database. Add draft/published status toggle.

implementationSteps.title: Comments, Categories & Search
implementationSteps.description: Create comment endpoints: POST /posts/:id/comments (authenticated users), GET /posts/:id/comments (public), DELETE /comments/:id (comment owner/admin). Implement category CRUD (admin only). Add search endpoint: GET /posts/search?q=keyword&category=tech. Use database full-text search or implement basic LIKE queries. Support filtering by date, category, author.

implementationSteps.title: Advanced Features & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Add pagination to all list endpoints with proper metadata. Implement rate limiting to prevent abuse (express-rate-limit). Add API documentation with Swagger/OpenAPI. Write integration tests for key flows. Set up CORS for frontend access. Deploy to Railway/Render with PostgreSQL database. Create Postman collection for easy testing. Document in README with example requests.

projects.title: E-Commerce Backend API with Payment Integration
projects.description: Build a complete e-commerce backend with products, cart, orders, Stripe payment integration, and admin dashboard
projects.shortDescription: Full e-commerce API with payments, orders, and inventory
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade e-commerce backend API with comprehensive features: product catalog with categories, shopping cart management, order processing, Stripe payment integration, inventory tracking, user wishlists, order history, and admin panel endpoints. This advanced project showcases complex business logic, payment processing, transaction management, and real-world backend architecture at scale.

implementationSteps.title: Database Design & Product Catalog
implementationSteps.description: Design comprehensive schema: User, Product (with variants: size, color, stock), Category, Cart, CartItem, Order, OrderItem, Payment. Create relationships: Product has many Variants, Cart has many CartItems (product + quantity), Order has many OrderItems. Add indexes on frequently queried fields (category, price, stock). Implement product CRUD with image upload, stock tracking, and category filtering.

implementationSteps.title: Shopping Cart Management
implementationSteps.description: Build cart endpoints: POST /cart/add (add product with variant), GET /cart (get user cart), PUT /cart/:itemId (update quantity), DELETE /cart/:itemId (remove item). Implement cart logic: check stock availability before adding, calculate subtotals, validate quantities. Handle edge cases: out of stock, cart expiration, concurrent updates. Use database transactions to ensure data consistency.

implementationSteps.title: Stripe Payment Integration
implementationSteps.description: Set up Stripe SDK and create payment endpoints: POST /checkout/create-intent (create payment intent with cart total), POST /checkout/confirm (confirm payment). Implement webhook endpoint to handle Stripe events: payment_intent.succeeded, payment_intent.failed. Validate webhook signatures for security. Handle payment failures gracefully with proper error messages.

implementationSteps.title: Order Processing & Inventory
implementationSteps.description: Create order workflow: POST /orders (create order from cart after payment). Implement atomic transaction: deduct inventory, create order record, clear cart, send confirmation email. Build order endpoints: GET /orders (user order history), GET /orders/:id (order details with tracking). Add order status: pending, confirmed, shipped, delivered, cancelled. Implement inventory management: prevent overselling, low stock alerts.

implementationSteps.title: Admin Panel & Advanced Features
implementationSteps.description: Build admin endpoints (role-based): GET/POST/PUT/DELETE /admin/products, GET /admin/orders (all orders with filters), PUT /admin/orders/:id/status (update order status), GET /admin/analytics (sales reports). Add product search with Elasticsearch or database full-text search. Implement caching with Redis for frequently accessed products. Write comprehensive tests. Deploy to AWS/GCP with proper environment setup, database backups, and monitoring.

implementationSteps.title: Security, Testing & Documentation
implementationSteps.description: Implement rate limiting and request throttling. Add input sanitization to prevent SQL injection. Set up HTTPS and secure headers. Write integration tests for critical flows (checkout, payment). Load test with Apache Bench or Artillery. Create comprehensive API documentation with Swagger. Set up logging and error tracking (Sentry). Deploy with CI/CD pipeline. Document setup instructions and environment variables in README.
